I hardcore relate to this. I was recently diagnosed with OCD, have been dealing with severe anxiety for most of my life, dealt with some trauma in childhood, etc. Jenna is like home. She never fails to make me feel better.

Constantly. My intrusive thoughts are more focused on other people doing things to me than me doing things to other people.

I have the same thing! If you can avoid the urge then logically it should help in the long run. I would try to find something to replace it with though. Not that I‚Äôm at all good at that, but ya that‚Äôs what my therapist recommended to me.
Occupational therapy major doing mental health as one of my internships, currently taking notes on trauma and TSDs. Huggggeeeeee mood

Me! I did super well in school and extracurriculars and stuff because I like to learn and worked really hard. But then no one noticed how hard I was struggling because ‚Äúoh she‚Äôs getting all A‚Äôs, she‚Äôs doing fine.‚Äù I had plenty of friends with similar problems to me who got lots of help because they were getting bad grades and stuff. Sucks now because I feel like I missed out on getting actual help.
Me too!
I have traits of autism but I‚Äôve never been diagnosed. But yes, most of my trauma is from sibling abuse. And yes, my differences were used against me a lot by my brother.

I‚Äôm getting kind of nervous about what that means for starting my next placement because I only have a one week buffer between them. Worst case scenario I‚Äôm going to have to start my second placement late and stay at my first longer or I‚Äôll stay at my second placement longer.

Yup. I was a really happy little kid but I‚Äôve been depressed since I was 8. I remember telling my first therapist when I was 9 that I didn‚Äôt understand why people are afraid of dying because I wanted to die.

My great aunt got me a little easel with this quote on it one time. I don‚Äôt even go on my phone much during family things. And she cant hear... so she doesn‚Äôt even participate in conversations at family things....

I get that too! I also get it in my ears. It‚Äôs like it goes from my ears, down my neck, to my breast bone and down my stomach. Not fun

Yup and it sucks because I‚Äôm currently in an internship and whenever my supervisor is watching I freeze. I know these are things that I can do but I‚Äôm so afraid of messing up and people‚Äôs responses when I mess up that I don‚Äôt do anything. I‚Äôm just so used to messing up being the absolute end of the world because that‚Äôs what happened growing up.

I can‚Äôt really help because I‚Äôm going through the same thing right now. I‚Äôve been scrolling for a bit to avoid crying at work, but I‚Äôll have to start again soon and keep up that happy persona again. It‚Äôs really hard, I feel you.

Ya I had pretty bad insomnia growing up. But it was always because I had super bad anxiety and no outlet for it. I was pretty emotionally neglected so even when I would tell my parents that stuff was making me nervous and making it hard for me to sleep they would pretty much send me back to bed without helping at all. I‚Äôm still learning ways to reduce that anxiety before bed and it‚Äôs definitely getting better. I really wish someone would‚Äôve helped me with it earlier though. 

Now I use melatonin and meditation before bed. I still have my stuffed toy from when I was a kid that I sleep with. I also read for about an hour before bed and then have Friends playing in the background because I know all of the episodes really well so it doesn‚Äôt keep me up.
I‚Äôm in health care, very few student loans, still poor
Yes! This is exactly what happens for me too!
Honestly same. I work with kids and they‚Äôre some of the few people I really trust. The adults at work are the ones who scare me.

Same. 24/7 except for tiny moments. Usually it‚Äôs like 30 seconds, but I held it for like 2 minutes the other day and it felt so good. I immediately realized I‚Äôd been living in a mess and got up to clean it up. I take my opportunities.
Mine is my cat too. Every time I think about ending it it breaks my heart a little because I don‚Äôt want to leave him. I don‚Äôt want to live, but I absolutely cannot leave him.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm tired and sad‚Äù Yup this is accurate üòÇ

I have social anxiety, CPTSD, and depression and I think there‚Äôs absolutely a line between what is caused by work and what just is. 

My CPTSD didn‚Äôt come from work, it came from childhood trauma. And that‚Äôs something that I want to heal from beyond issues related to work. 

My social anxiety and depression are essentially genetic. My whole family suffers with various levels of anxiety and depression.

I think work is really just something that exacerbates everything. Without work, I would still be mentally ill and I would still want to heal. Work makes it harder because I have less time to focus on recovery and I have to be around people everyday which is anxiety inducing and when I don‚Äôt have enough time to do things I love I feel more depressed. But those things would exist without work. 

I think it depends on the person, but most of the time work is an exacerbating factor, not the cause.
Oh.... both of my parents have anxiety.... this makes so much sense üôÉ
I totally agree!
Floortime is often considered to be the opposite of ABA!

Absolutely. My boss keeps telling me to call out when I‚Äôm sick and I like genuinely have no concept of how sick is sick enough to call out. I force myself through work and chores and everything no matter how sick I am. It sucks.

I just sent this to my friends to explain why i feel this way. I just started clinicals for school and I‚Äôm putting so much effort into being a person all day and not showing my trauma and then i get home and eating and showering and everything is hard.
And on top of that I feel like since I‚Äôm in a new job that I‚Äôve never done with new people everyone is trying to kind of figure me out and soooo much of who i am is based in my trauma. But I‚Äôm obviously not gonna be like ‚Äúya I‚Äôm like this because of the trauma‚Äù so I‚Äôm just kind of trying to seem extra normal right now. And it‚Äôs exhausting.
Yay!!! So proud of you!!

Slightly related but I‚Äôve been working on developing boundaries and at the same time I‚Äôve started working at a therapeutic preschool for kids with autism. And there are a lot of kids who try to use other people‚Äôs bodies to stim and sometimes it really hurts. But I would just let the kids do stuff cuz I was like well they need this and I can help them so I‚Äôll let it happen. And then one day this girl was shoving her chin into my arm really hard and my educator was like ‚Äúyou don‚Äôt have to let her do that??‚Äù. And it honestly blew my mind. Like I don‚Äôt have to suffer to make other people happy. And even typing that feels weird but it‚Äôs true. It‚Äôs just wild when people point stuff out like this or the burned toast. Like my brain so doesn‚Äôt process stuff the same way other people do.
No she doesn‚Äôt, that really bothered me too. Especially because she knows I have CPTSD
Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è
Ya I realized this a couple years ago and it hurt. There‚Äôs definitely a whole ‚Äúapologizing to your kids is showing weakness club‚Äù.
I should do this, my cat arm flops at least once a day
Ya I tend to vomit during episodes or get like major stomach pain. It‚Äôs rare that it doesn‚Äôt end in vomiting though.

I was looking for a post like this. I needed to hear from someone else who‚Äôs not happy today. Everyone‚Äôs so fucking happy. Flexing all their accomplishments from the last 10 years and I feel like it‚Äôs been a downward slide the whole time. Idk. Today hurts.

I‚Äôm so sorry this happened to you. I had many similar experiences. Once, when I was probably 7 or 8, I was in one of those blow up pools in my backyard and my brother went and got the dog‚Äôs little plastic pool and put it on top of me and sat on it, trying to drown me. Needless to say he didn‚Äôt because my mom just happened to run out of the house in time to stop him. Of course neither of them seem to remember that happening üôÑ

Ya this is something I talk about with my therapist A LOT. My parents always said this stuff to me. ‚ÄúJust stay away from him‚Äù was a big one. Worse for me was ‚Äúwell if you would stop annoying him he wouldn‚Äôt do that‚Äù. Like what a fucked up thing to tell a kid. That they‚Äôre at fault for what‚Äôs happening to them. And the things that were ‚Äúannoying‚Äù were usually just me existing. Looking toward him or tapping my fingers or something.
Lmao ya before Thanksgiving my therapist told me it would be ‚Äúa good opportunity to think about the origin of some of my behaviors‚Äù
Harry is keeping me going rn too
I‚Äôve had this for soooo long. Even when i was a kid I would tell my mom I wanted to go home when we were already home.

It‚Äôs Kind of a Funny Story did a lot of good for me, they both did, but in different ways. I recommended it to a friend who had a rough experience in an inpatient mental health facility and it really helped her come to terms with everything that happened
Every time I open instagram I say ‚Äútime to trigger myself!‚Äù
I‚Äôm only alive for my cat. I can‚Äôt imagine breaking his heart that much.

My therapist gave me a couple reasons she thinks I have them. 

My brother has severe anger issues and needed a lot of attention growing up because of that. A lot of the time my parents would put the blame on me or on both of us rather than just him (we‚Äôre now 22 and 24 and to this day that still happens). A lot of times I would also miss out on attention because they were focused on what he needed. So basically I was emotionally neglected. 

My therapist mostly said this was why. That even when I thought my parents were there for me, they would ‚Äúleave‚Äù. And I ended up with abandonment issues.

I‚Äôve always been a super anxious person. When I was like 12 I started compulsively lying for attention, but I don‚Äôt think I knew it was anything specific then. Around that time I started getting really depressed and suicidal and started cutting. I knew something was off then, but I don‚Äôt think it was until a couple years ago, my sophomore year of undergrad, when I started obsessing over my friend and where she was and what she was doing all the time that I realized something was really really off. But I thought it was a crush until I started getting insanely depressed over it and self harming and stuff over it.

Ya i absolutely hate Facebook. I still have an account but I rarely use it and when I do it just makes me depressed. I know people say all of this about Instagram but I honestly have less of an issue with it because I choose to follow mostly people I don‚Äôt know in real life like celebrities and stuff. 

Facebook just sucks because I can see what people are doing and they always make everything seem perfect like you said. It really fucks with my head. I also hate the whole having to friend everyone thing like you said. 

I never really posted much and i somehow managed to never do the ranting thing. About a year ago I went through and unfriended 90% of my ‚Äúfriends‚Äù. I‚Äôm down to like 40 people and frankly I‚Äôm only friends with some of them because they‚Äôre in my grad school class of only like 24 people and it would be awkward if I wasn‚Äôt friends with them. 

I still really hate it though. I don‚Äôt go on it when I can. I hate that I get emails about what people are posting. It‚Äôs like I‚Äôm being forced to look at things I‚Äôm avoiding. It just all sucks and I hate that so much of the population is part of it. It kind of makes me lose faith in humanity.
